intro: Biscutella ciliata var. applanata, commonly known as the flatleaf biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces yellow flowers in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive waxy coating. This variety is noted for its unique leaf shape and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
